ygData.messageBody:
According to Marziani, Michael D.:
> I don't know why but it has never made sense to me to charge for services
> such as binding, invis, and language training. Perhaps it is just the
> personality of my character that he enjoys helping others and gets full
> satisfaction out of the good deed itself, not needing any sort of physical
> compensation.

This is also why I suggested you invest in useful life-saving spells
before checking Bind. If someone binds me, I'll give something (usually the
gold I have at hand) if possible, but do not expect to be given something
once it's me doing the binding.

I might charge something (probably) symbolic once I get to the gates and
portals levels, since I took upon the Wizard class almost solely for the
purpose of using these spells (I enjoy teleport. I always end up a gaming
session by bowing to friends, then gating for the fun of it. Even when I
was in Faydark's Orc camp and moving back to Felwithe). "Newbie transport
service. Express from Faydark to Erud or Queynos. Binding at destination
if required".

> that just seems unkind. I remember when I was level 8 just travelling over
> to freeport. I only had a couple of my new 3rd circle spells because they
> were so expensive and I was flat broke. I saw people auctioning: "Binding

One trick, which works for some spells only alas: Look at other guild
merchant. Some have spells that are shared across classes, and are of lower
circle than ours for other classes. Why, I was surprised at the Freeport
guild of finding an Sense Summoned (level 8) for 4gp... until I realised
the merchant was a Magician merchant (and they get Sense at level 4)...

> I guess it is just based on your roleplaying style, but even if I have no
> money and still have spells to buy, I would not ask for or accept any sort
> of payment for using my talents. Does anyone else agree with me or do you
> all think that you SHOULD rightfully earn a profit from using your skills?

Alas, I am afraid it is the only part of the player economy that works...
because it costs nothing to make :(
